general_advisory: Dry weather with partly cloudy sky. Maximum temperatures between 30-31°C and minimum temperatures between 19-22°C. Increasing temperature conditions should prompt farmers to apply irrigation. Various pest management and disease control measures are advised for different crops.

advisory: In transplanted paddy, spray Bispyribac Sodium 10% E.C. or Ethoxysulfuron 15% WDG at 3 to 4 leaf stage.
To manage Bud Necrosis disease, spray Neem Based Pesticide or chemical insecticides as needed.
For Sett Rot management, use Carbendazim + Mancozeb basal drenching or foliar spray with Metalaxyl + Mancozeb.
To control aphids, spray Neem Based Pesticide followed by chemical insecticides.
To manage Fruit rot and Die back disease, spray fungicides at specific stages of crop growth.
To control Alternaria Leaf Spot, spray Mancozeb or carbendazim fungicides.
For Purple Blotch and Stemphylium leaf blight, spray Mancozeb or other fungicides at specific intervals.
To manage mango hoppers, spray specific insecticides at recommended timings.
To control Powdery mildew, spray Carbendazim as a preventive measure.
For Foot and mouth diseases of cattle, ensure FMD vaccination once a year.
Vaccinate chicks for Sleeping disease with specific vaccines at recommended timings.
